intro: Bauerella leiocarpa, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually a deep green color. Its flowers are yellow and bell-shaped, appearing in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. Bauerella leiocarpa is often found in dry sclerophyllous forests and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
